title: aaroncryptt
author: aaroncryptt
content: Hello everyone,  exchange of BTC (10% less market) to USDT/ ETH , all details in telegram @webaaroncryptPlease no scammers

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: aaroncryptt on March 28, 2023, 01:37:37 PMHello everyone,  exchange of BTC (10% less market) to USDT/ ETH , all details in telegram @webaaroncryptPlease no scammersHow much btc are you willing to exchange (kindly specify minimum and maximum limits)? Interested in using any kind of escrow or you go first ? I assume you want to sell (and not buy) your btc for 10% less than market price, right ?

comments.author: Usdt2023
comments.created_time: March 29, 2023, 05:28:43 AMLast edit: March 30, 2023, 06:55:36 AM by Usdt2023
comments.body: I'm going to deal with him Edit: he sent me 98.78USD I'm waiting confirmation so I can send him his usdt https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/8348c52fc3580aae8cbd8c640b9f7454665d9266df3d69d83c02c631de3044b7Edit he is a scammer

comments.author: Behat1981
comments.body: Quote from: aaroncryptt on March 28, 2023, 01:37:37 PMHello everyone,  exchange of BTC (10% less market) to USDT/ ETH , all details in telegram @webaaroncryptPlease no scammersHow much can you do? I have $2000+ usdt and can exchange for btc

comments.author: TracaChang
comments.body: He is just a scammer, I've contacted him and this is how it works:He is willing to send BTC first, but he sends with RBF and a very low transaction fee, then he asks you to send USDT and insists a lot, since I've said him to just wait for 1 confirmation and I would send the USDT... chat was over and he used RBF to get back the transaction.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Too good to be true.  Quote from: TracaChang on March 29, 2023, 06:58:53 PMHe is willing to send BTC first, but he sends with RBF and a very low transaction fee, then he asks you to send USDT and insists a lot, since I've said him to just wait for 1 confirmation and I would send the USDT... chat was over and he used RBF to get back the transaction.It does not seem that what he is trying to do is smart, but rather an attempt to deceive the beginners. Can you attach proof of screenshot or the transaction link or any details so that we can verify your words.In general, until you confirm this, it is better to consider @aaroncryptt is a scammer.

comments.author: TracaChang
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on March 30, 2023, 03:16:10 AMToo good to be true.  Quote from: TracaChang on March 29, 2023, 06:58:53 PMHe is willing to send BTC first, but he sends with RBF and a very low transaction fee, then he asks you to send USDT and insists a lot, since I've said him to just wait for 1 confirmation and I would send the USDT... chat was over and he used RBF to get back the transaction.It does not seem that what he is trying to do is smart, but rather an attempt to deceive the beginners. Can you attach proof of screenshot or the transaction link or any details so that we can verify your words.In general, until you confirm this, it is better to consider @aaroncryptt is a scammer.The transaction link I do not have it anymore it was on telephone and did not save but I saw tx in wallet disappeared.There's however another user who shared a transaction as you can see, it is a transactions where he sends funds back to himself: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/transaction/8348c52fc3580aae8cbd8c640b9f7454665d9266df3d69d83c02c631de3044b7I do still have however the telegram conversation where he just agrees to send btc and ask me why I did not send USDT, once I've said because has RBF and fees are low that I will send when 1 confirm conversation stops.

comments.author: SimpleThings
comments.body: Sounds to good to be true
